dublinCore.dc:title: 118 HR 386 IH: Mount Rushmore Protection Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Johnson of South Dakota (for himself, Mr. Guest, Mr. Mooney, Mr. LaMalfa, Mr. Banks, Ms. Mace, Mr. Stewart, Mr. Nehls, Mrs. Radewagen, and Ms. Tenney) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Natural Resources

form.official-title: To provide that no Federal funds shall be used to alter, change, destroy, or remove, in whole or in part, any name, face, or other feature on the Mount Rushmore National Memorial.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Mount Rushmore Protection Act.

paragraph.text: Mount Rushmore National Memorial is America’s Shrine of Democracy.
The Mount Rushmore National Memorial depicts the faces of Presidents George Washington, Thomas Jefferson, Theodore Roosevelt, and Abraham Lincoln, with the beauty of the Black Hills of South Dakota.

section.header: Prohibition on use of Federal funds
section.text: No Federal funds shall be used to alter, change, destroy, or remove, in whole or in part, any name, face, or other feature on the Mount Rushmore National Memorial.

subsection.text: The mountain at Mount Rushmore, South Dakota, located at N 43° 53.559′ W 103° 28.246′, shall be known and designated as Mount Rushmore.

Any reference in any law, map, regulation, order, document, paper, or other record of the United States to the mountain and area described in subsection (a) shall be deemed to be a reference to Mount Rushmore.
